data: Mim Lal Nakarmi Associate Professor Brooklyn College (718)951-5000 x2867 MLNakarmi@brooklyn.cuny.edu Website Ph. D. from Kansas State University in 2005 Wide bandgap semiconductor material synthesis, and characterization for photonic applications. My research interests are the development and study of novel materials for UV photonic applications. My research projects include the epitaxy and nanostructure growth of wide band gap semiconductors such as GaN, AlN, ZnO, BN using Chemical vapor deposition (CVD) technique and characterization of the materials for their electrical, optical, structural properties.  Selected Publications:  Cai, B., M.L. Nakarmi, B.S. Franks and R.C. Rai. "Electro-optical Effects and Temperature-dependent Electrical Properties of LuFe2O4 Thin Films." Thin Solid Films 562: 490-94.
